docs.snippet: Photographs posted on Facebook show the prime minister of Japan, Shinzo Abe, and the president of the United States as they scrambled to respond to a North Korean ballistic missile test.

headline.main: Scenes From Mar-a-Lago as Trump and Abe Get News About North Korea

docs.snippet: The Pay Pal founder and Trump fan, interviewed by Maureen Dowd, prefers “Star Wars” to “Star Trek” and is in favor of California’s seceding.
In a new Hemingway biography, “Writer, Sailor, Soldier, Spy,” the historian Nicholas Reynolds details his subject’s work for a precursor to the K.G.B.

headline.main: The Great American Novelist Who Spied for the Soviets

docs.snippet: When Washington, D.C., tried to draw attention to reports of missing teenagers, activists thought the campaign was because of a spike in abductions.

headline.main: Police Posted Missing Teenagers’ Data on Social Media. A City Took Note.

docs.snippet: Mark Zuckerberg and his wife, Dr. Priscilla Chan, have hired two former presidential campaign managers for the company they set up for charitable efforts.

headline.print_headline: Zuckerberg and Chan Add Muscle to Giving
headline.main: Chan Zuckerberg Initiative Builds Political Muscle for Philanthropic Work

docs.snippet: The deaths underscore the strength of the insurgency in the restive peninsula despite four years of concerted government counterterrorism efforts.

headline.print_headline: Raid on Militants’ Base Is Deadly for Both Sides
headline.main: Egypt Says 10 Soldiers and 15 Militants Are Killed in Sinai Fight

docs.snippet: It’s still very possible that virtual reality will be a hit, but not until there’s more content available and the cost of equipment comes down.

headline.main: Daily Report: Virtual Reality Has Not Quite Arrived

docs.snippet: A reader writes that it’s hard to imagine Americans making the leap.
People are increasingly using the technology on their mobile devices and computers to block intrusive advertisements while surfing the web.

headline.print_headline: Use of Ad Blockers Rises by 30%, Led by Developing World
headline.main: Use of Ad-Blocking Software Rises by 30% Worldwide

docs.snippet: Start with the atmosphere. Don’t worry about wrapping everything up.

headline.print_headline: How to Tell a Ghost Story
headline.main: How to Tell a Ghost Story
